Families gain a structured emergency response tool connected to their policies.

Policy documents

Proof of insurance

Power of attorney, living wills

Medical records

Secure, encrypted, auditable access logs

“Review your medical emergency plan with family this weekend”

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Insurance companies today struggle with:
Low customer engagement between claims,
Poor policyholder awareness of emergency protocols,
Lack of data on family preparedness, despite covering health, life, home, auto, and legal risks,
Limited tools for customers to proactively reduce risk.
At the same time, families are increasingly:
Caring for aging parents, young kids, or vulnerable members,
Facing more frequent natural disasters, mental health crises, and medical emergencies,
Unprepared for most emergencies beyond calling 911.
There’s no structured, smart, policy-aware emergency response app designed for families and insurance providers.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

SafeKin leverages ServiceNow’s core strengths:

ITSM / CSM to manage emergency incidents and response tasks.

Flow Designer to automate and orchestrate crisis workflows for medical, mental health, and disaster scenarios.

Virtual Agent to provide real-time, conversational support during high-stress moments.

Vault for secure, role-based storage of sensitive family and insurance documents.

Performance Analytics to score family preparedness and identify risk exposure trends.

App Engine Studio for low-code customization by insurers, HR teams, or advanced users.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Location Services API (for emergency tracking)

Calendar & Notification APIs (reminders, drills)

Secure Storage & Encryption Modules (for document handling)

Optional AI/ML Layer (for suggesting workflows or detecting risk patterns)

Insurance Provider API integration (e.g., fetch policy data, file claim triggers)

Multi-device Accessibility (Mobile-first, low-friction UI)

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

One major challenge is privacy and data security, given the sensitive nature of family medical, legal, and insurance information. This can be addressed by leveraging ServiceNow Vault, along with strict access control policies, consent layers, and audit trails.

Adoption complexity is another concern, especially for families who may not be familiar with structured digital workflows. To reduce friction, SafeKin will feature an intuitive onboarding experience with guided setup wizards, pre-built templates, and even light gamification to encourage engagement.

For insurers with legacy systems or diverse APIs, integration could be a bottleneck. This risk can be mitigated by building a modular connector layer that abstracts insurer-specific logic, making the app flexible and pluggable into different backend systems.

Cross-generational usability is also a critical concern, older adults, younger users, and tech-averse family members must all be able to interact with the app. A clean, accessible UI with multilingual support and voice-based input options will be essential to ensure inclusivity.
